titleInfo.title: USA v. McQuay et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER entered denying 68 Motion for nunc pro tunc designation for service of concurrent federal and state sentences as to Jermaine Antonio Pugh. Signed by Judge Kristi K. DuBose on 3/8/2010. copy mailed to defendant (mca)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 1:07-cr-00199; USA v. McQuay et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Southern District of Alabama
extension.docketText: ORDER entered denying 68 Motion for nunc pro tunc designation for service of concurrent federal and state sentences as to Jermaine Antonio Pugh. Signed by Judge Kristi K. DuBose on 3/8/2010. copy mailed to defendant (mca)

titleInfo.title: USA v. McQuay et al
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT ON REVOCATION OF SUPERVISED RELEASE TERM. The Court REVOKES the supervised release term and sentences the offender to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for seven months; credit for time served (2 weeks). Upon release from custody, the offender shall be placed on re-supervised release for a term of 24 months. The Court re-imposes all of the original and special conditions that were initially imposed on January 18, 2008: the offender shall participate in a program of testing and treatment for drug and/or alcohol abuse, as directed by the Probation Office. Defendant remanded to the custody of the USM. Signed by Judge Kristi K. DuBose on 12/23/2010. (mca)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 1:07-cr-00199; USA v. McQuay et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Southern District of Alabama
extension.docketText: JUDGMENT ON REVOCATION OF SUPERVISED RELEASE TERM. The Court REVOKES the supervised release term and sentences the offender to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for seven months; credit for time served (2 weeks). Upon release from custody, the offender shall be placed on re-supervised release for a term of 24 months. The Court re-imposes all of the original and special conditions that were initially imposed on January 18, 2008: the offender shall participate in a program of testing and treatment for drug and/or alcohol abuse, as directed by the Probation Office. Defendant remanded to the custody of the USM. Signed by Judge Kristi K. DuBose on 12/23/2010. (mca)

titleInfo.title: USA v. McQuay et al
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT ON REVOCATION OF SUPERVISED RELEASE TERM as to Andre Clarence McQuay. The Court REVOKES the supervised release term and sentences the offender to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for a term of three months. Upon release from imprisonment, the offender shall be placed on re-supervised release for a term of 27 months. The Court re-imposes all of the original and special conditions that were initially imposed on January 25, 2008: the offender shall participate in a program of testing and treatment for drug and/or alcohol abuse, as directed by the Probation Office; and, the offender shall participate in a program of mental health treatment and/or counseling, as directed by the Probation Office. Defendant remanded to the custody of the USM. Signed by Judge Kristi K. DuBose on 1/4/2013. (mca)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 1:07-cr-00199; USA v. McQuay et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Southern District of Alabama
extension.docketText: JUDGMENT ON REVOCATION OF SUPERVISED RELEASE TERM as to Andre Clarence McQuay. The Court REVOKES the supervised release term and sentences the offender to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for a term of three months. Upon release from imprisonment, the offender shall be placed on re-supervised release for a term of 27 months. The Court re-imposes all of the original and special conditions that were initially imposed on January 25, 2008: the offender shall participate in a program of testing and treatment for drug and/or alcohol abuse, as directed by the Probation Office; and, the offender shall participate in a program of mental health treatment and/or counseling, as directed by the Probation Office. Defendant remanded to the custody of the USM. Signed by Judge Kristi K. DuBose on 1/4/2013. (mca)
